Science & Technology.name: Digital Echoes
Science & Technology.description: Delve into the history of computing with this quiz, exploring everything from early storage media to iconic Apple designs and celestial exploration.

questions.text: What does the 'ROM' in CD-ROM stand for?
questions.hint: This term describes a type of computer memory that cannot be altered.

questions.text: Modern computer microchips are primarily composed of what element?
questions.hint: This element is abundant in sand and central to the semiconductor industry.

questions.text: In computer terminology, what does the acronym 'FTP' stand for?
questions.hint: This protocol is used to move files between computers over the internet.

questions.text: The Original Apple iMac computer was available in all of the following colors except which?
questions.hint: The iMac colors were fruit-inspired, but this one wasn’t part of the original lineup.

questions.text: Phoebe, Dione and Helene are moons of what planet?
questions.hint: This planet is famous for its extensive ring system.

Science & Technology.name: Melting Point Mysteries
Science & Technology.description: Test your knowledge of physical science and computer basics with this quiz, covering everything from phase transitions to internet infrastructure.

questions.text: What is the chemical process wherein a solid is turned to a liquid via the application of heat?
questions.hint: This process is what happens when ice becomes water on a warm day.

questions.text: Paper will burn at approximately what temperature, in Fahrenheit?
questions.hint: This temperature is famously referenced in a dystopian novel about book burning.

questions.text: What force causes an ice cream cone to fly off of a spinning merry-go-round?
questions.hint: This force is related to the outward pull felt on spinning objects.

questions.text: What is the square root of 81 squared?
questions.hint: First calculate 81 squared, then find the number that, when multiplied by itself, equals that result.

questions.text: In computer terminology, what does the acronym 'ISP' stand for?
questions.hint: This service connects you to the internet, like Comcast or Verizon.

Science & Technology.name: Asteroid Orbit & Light Speed
Science & Technology.description: Explore the cosmos and fundamental scientific principles with this quiz, covering asteroid exploration, the speed of light, and DNA replication.

questions.text: On Valentine's Day 2000, NASA's NEAR spacecraft began a yearlong orbit of what asteroid?
questions.hint: The asteroid’s name is fitting for a Valentine’s Day mission, tied to love.

questions.text: What is the approximate speed of light?
questions.hint: This speed is incredibly fast, measured in miles per second, not hour.

questions.text: What biological process replicates DNA?
questions.hint: This process occurs during cell division to create identical copies of genetic material.

Science & Technology.name: Earth's Spin & Ada's Algorithm
Science & Technology.description: Discover the secrets of our planet's rotation and the pioneering work of Ada Lovelace, alongside questions about computer components.

questions.text: At the equator, how fast is the earth's surface turning?
questions.hint: The speed is significant due to the Earth's rotation, covering a large distance daily.

questions.text: Ada Lovelace is credited with being the first person to have made what?
questions.hint: Her work with Charles Babbage involved early concepts of computing.

questions.text: Modern computer microchips are primarily composed of what element?
questions.hint: This element is abundant in sand and central to the semiconductor industry.
